title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: there was a 15-minute phone screening, followed by a 1-hour zoom call with the lab manager. He asked some technical and behavioral questions. overall it was a good interview.The interview was very polite and friendly
Interview Questions: What is your favorite thing to do in lab?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone screen.  I was asked a few questions. I was asked could I start June 30th. I was also asked if working remote was okay with me which would be a plus for me.

title: Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I’ve had two interviews for this position, about a week apart. First one with HR and second with the hiring manager.
They were both through zoom and both interviews went so amazing because of how comfortable they make you feel.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you’re interested in this role

title: Application Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: They have a great interviewprocess, I felt comfortable and welcomed. I was tested on my knowledge of my particular area of expertise thoroughly. All in all a very fun process.
Interview Questions: I was asked to explain an obstacle I had faced in my career, and asked to demonstrate how I overcame that obstacle.

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Drawn out process with recruiter, then manager, then technical panel interview. Next step would have been interview with higher-up. 
Did not connect with the panel--I found them cold and humorless. The work environment was a grim warren of cubicles; would not relish the prospect of being chained there.
In the end the feedback to the recruiter was that they doubted my troubleshooting skills. After being in the business actively for more than 20 years, while the panelists were likely in middle school, I felt that rejection was ageist, not to mention lame.
Interview Questions: White board and describe a network you've worked on.

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: it took two months, first a general interview on phone by Manager and then I was flown to NC for a 4 hour interview first met CIO and then the team members
Interview Questions: Tell a difficult technical situation you tackled

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and convenient. I was screened via phone call, then called in for an interview day. I had an interview with the process owner, the chief PMO officer, the manager of the PMO, as well as a team panel interview.
Interview Questions: What projects have you worked on, what type of communication method do you use, what organization style do you prefer, etc.

title: Epic SER Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: They were quick to initially reach out to show interest but took a few months to eventually get to do an interview on site. Once I got onsite they showed me around to meet some of the staff but with it being a Friday hardly anyone was in the office since they were mostly working from home.
Interview Questions: What I like and don't like about what I do.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The manager described the job duties and then asked me several behavioral type questions. She also explained the hours involved and the expectations of the employees.  She also asked several technical questions related to the position and presented situations to me and asked how I would handle them.
Interview Questions: What can you do to promote teamwork?

title: David Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions
Interview Descriptions:
This was a panel style interview.  All were friendly and was a decent experience.  Found out afterwards that they have to interview who applies to the positions bc of policy, but that they normally hire from within and are looking for certain people to hire.  They also do not always keep the comments from the interview to them selves and break this confidentiality agreement.

Long story short:  tell them what they want to hear, not your true feelings.  There are many snitches here.
Interview Questions: What magazine subscriptions do you have to stay up on technology?

title: Senior IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health Technology Solutions (Durham, NC) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Initially phone interviewed with hiring manager who did a tertiary interview of my technical skills. Focus was mostly on soft skills. Followup was a very technical interview with senior technician. After these, was brought on-site for a full-on interview with mangers, technicians, and users; some were one-on-one and some panel type. Good process where all were able to determine a lot through this process.
